input: kab milna hai?we'll have to start earlythere is no way out of thisThe implemented incentive system is straightforward. The velocity at each condition is measured and converted to kilometers per hour. When a collision happens, the reward is set to -20 (but it can be any lower value on the negative scale). The payout is -1 when the speed is less than 50 km/h. The reward is set to +1 in all other circumstances.As demonstrated in Figs. 2, 3, and 4, we may operate the environment on one system and numerous agents on various machines using Carla. Multiple sensors, like as cameras, LiDARs, Radars, and accelerometers, may be added to the automobile to imitate the real-life experience. The Python API is also included for interacting with the environment and agents. Manual navigation is also possible on the map.During the setup of our system to configure the environment we had a help of a friend, as it was intensive setup process and had intensive hardware requirements, we then setup the simulator on an Dell XPS system with a RTX 1050 GPU with 16GB RAM and an Intel Core i7 processor with 8 cores. To get weights, we used two distinct CNN models: the Xception Model (which has 71 hidden layers) and a simpler CNN model (with 3 hidden layers). We attempted numerous episodes several times but failed and terminated in the middle. Finally, we determined that each update would run for at least 1000 episodes. The overall training process took over 8-9 hours to complete and there were a lot of bottlenecks because of which we had to restart the process multiple times.In this project, we use Deep-Q Learning to perform reinforcement learning on simulated autonomous vehicles. Our model makes use of a gaming environment with characteristics such as dynamic weather, pedestrians, and roundabouts to allow the model to train in real-time situations. Simultaneously, it increases the vehicle's safety metric dynamically without compromising autonomous driving performance. We use a deep Q-network (DQN), a form of artificial neural network that integrate reinforcement learning with deep neural networks.
